text: AWS is really impacting the culture at
corp info because we specialize in
helping customers on their migration to
the AWS cloud and providing them support
services for their infrastructure in AWS
my name is Stephen garden I'm the cloud
practice director at corp info we are an
Amazon premier consulting partner based
in santa monica california we do a lot
of business with digital media
organizations that are seeking to change
their own business models by utilizing a
cloud-based architecture overall it's
hard not to want to recommend AWS for
most use cases the breadth and depth of
services are phenomenal and also it's
delivered a very affordable and economic
price point meaning that there's always
a great business case to explore the use
of AWS versus any alternate option the
decision to work with AWS was actually
quite a simple one and from a partnering
perspective we found that Amazon was the
most open organization that showed a lot
of willingness to help us develop our
business by utilizing AWS we've been
able to vastly shorten the amount of
time it takes us to engage with clients
and get started working on their
infrastructure previously projects could
take you know five weeks or longer to
mobilize with AWS we've reduced that now
down to a short number of days our
experience with the Amazon partner
network has been fantastic we've had a
huge amount of support both from a
training and skills certification
perspective and also from a business
development and sales and marketing
perspective the Amazon partner network
has been a fantastic development program
as well as we've moved through the tears
to become a premier consulting partner
we felt that each stage we've been
provided with new and additional
resources to help us in that transition
becoming a premier partner was a great
achievement for us AWS has really
changed the type of conversation we're
having with clients we're now able to go
to our customers and say that we have
the world's largest infrastructure
available to them it actually feels like
we're standing on the shoulders of AWS
you
